required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Location of Nerve Block to Minimize Perioperative Opioid Administration in ACL Surgery: Comparing True Adductor Canal to Proximal Block
clinical_study.official_title: Optimal Location of Nerve Block to Minimize Perioperative Opioid Administration in ACL Surgery: Comparing True Adductor Canal to Proximal Block

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective, randomized, single blinded trial involving human subjects. The goal of this study is to determine an optimal location (proximal or distal) for the nerve block and whether it will make a difference in how much opioid the patient will receive during and after surgery. Ultrasound will identify the adductor canal and the proximal end of the adductor canal/apex of the femoral triangle to determine the location of the blocks.
Their will be two randomized groups: 1. ACB within true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc2. ACB proximal to true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc

primary_outcome.measure: Total Opioid Consumption Intraop Measured by Amounts of Morphine Equivalents
primary_outcome.description: Amount of morphine equivalents administered intraoperatively in 24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Total Opioid Consumption Postop Measured by Amounts of Morphine Equivalents
primary_outcome.description: Amount of morphine equivalents administered postoperatively in 24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Side Effects Such as Nausea, Itching, Constipation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motor Block (Muscle Weakness): in PACU and Measured in Surgeons' Clinic at 3, 6 and 12 Months.

arm_group.arm_group_label: ACB within true AC with bupivacaine
arm_group.description: The patients will receive an ultrasound-guided single injection adductor canal block with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivacaine

arm_group.arm_group_label: ACB proximal to true AC with bupivacaine
arm_group.description: The patients will receive an ultrasound-guided single injection femoral triangle block with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivacaine

intervention.intervention_name: ACB within true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc
intervention.description: The adductor canal block (ACB) is more commonly being used to provide post-operative analgesia since it provides a sensory block with minimal motor block.
intervention.arm_group_label: ACB within true AC with bupivacaine

intervention.intervention_name: ACB proximal to true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc
intervention.description: Patients will receive ultra-sound guided single femoral triangle block injection with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivicaine
intervention.arm_group_label: ACB proximal to true AC with bupivacaine

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: ACB Within True AC With Bupivacaine
group.description: The patients will receive an ultrasound-guided single injection adductor canal block with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivacaine ACB within true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc: The adductor canal block (ACB) is more commonly being used to provide post-operative analgesia since it provides a sensory block with minimal motor block.

group.title: ACB Proximal to True AC With Bupivacaine
group.description: The patients will receive an ultrasound-guided single injection femoral triangle block with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivacaine ACB proximal to true AC with bupivacaine 0.5% 20cc: Patients will receive ultra-sound guided single femoral triangle block injection with 20 mL of 0.5% bupivicaine

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
